Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Noregrets_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in July and the stay was amazing. The stay was very friendly and helpful with getting me a map of the Rome and showing me the best way to get to the places that I wanted to go. They also recommended good places to eat as well. The price was not too bad either, I think I paid about 265 euros for the four night stay (Fri-Tue). The hotel was very well kept up. It also had a very good breakfast included. The location is about 15 min north from the Termini station, the closest Metra stop is Repbblica, about 5 min southwest of the hotel. I enjoyed my stay here. Also if you have the Rick Steve's guidebook, one of his recommended restaurants is right across the street. (This is also one of his recommended hotels!)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sean R
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel in a travel guide. The price was right but the description was less than stellar. Very pleasantly surprised by the experience! Had a room for five that suited my family's needs, the location was good, and the staff was exemplary in terms of helpfulness and tips.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Linleymac
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel in September of last year. We wanted a budget hotel and this one fit our budget. I loved this spot because of the staff. I've read some of the reviews and if you are looking for a high end resort style hotel, then don't look in this price range. For 80 euros per night, it was perfect. It is very close to the train station (a few minutes walk away which wasn't bad even though we had backpacks). We were backpacking and this was our first stop and we fell in love. Monica is absolutely amazing! She is just such a beautiful woman!! She speaks great English and is so helpful with the tourist attractions in the city. She's a true gem. Every morning we woke up to fresh baked croissants made by the same lady who was in early to make them and then to clean the rooms. They were so delicious and had a light dusting of icing sugar. Plenty of tea, coffee and juice at all hours! The rooms may be small and the bathrooms outdated but it's clean and everything else makes up for it and really, you're in Rome...who cares :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, family-run hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lp2706 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay in Rome, good location close to train station. Clean and tidy room (traditional decor), very helpful staff and excellent breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and a pleasure to stay”
Reviews.Author: ianandjoc4y Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Rome - a great hotel for a short stay, cheap, clean and with really friendly and helpful staff. Easy to find from Termini Station too. I have already booked back in for a slightly longer stay next time I am travelling through Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: ShaiH
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget accommodation with abit of style and feeling of an hotel. We stayed for 3 nights and we werent expecting to much. It's reasonably clean and is tidy every day. Yes the bathroom is small but for 87 euro it's excellent there is wifi and small breakfast 2 pastries and serial simple machine coffee and juice with packet toast. It's on the 4th floor but with elevator and close to buses from termini station (ie bus 84) and to repulic square metroe. We are a young coupe 26 and 27 and we walked from the hotel to all of ancient Rome district including colosseum for example the trevi fountain is approx 1.4 km away and it's a nice walk. Another plus is that it's just off from the tourist area and some nice budget resturAnts in the area. To conclude this is 2 star hotel is perfect for our needs and hate backpacker hostels. If your looking for a4 star hotel keep in mind this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient little no frills place”
Reviews.Author: LondonMurph65 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: It's situated on the 4th floor of a large building & served by a small (2 person but rated 4) old, cage lift. Not easy access for the disabled. My room was small and overlooked the street which was noisy from about 6am, but double glazing did help. Had air con, and shower en suite. TV had no Engish language programmes, which I would liked to have had for News. Breakfast is continental but orange juice was from powder and coffee from machine was! well, not to my liking, had to drink tea. Rolls were nice though. However the staff were really helpful and the room was comfortable enough. Good little resturant (Giovanni's) opposite. For the price it was good value. I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent spot, ok value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: erin77nyc
Reviews.Content: Rome is an expensive city so it was difficult to find a spot in our budget. Thus, we landed at Margaret on a tip from Rick Steve's book. Sure enough they had a room available on the same day. Room was a bit older with some stains throughout, but you learn to accept that in Europe. Cleanliness was ok, not the cleanest place I have stayed but not the worst. Location was good, close to Termini and other public transport, as well as an easy hike to the sites. Breakfast was ok, a few cereals and pastries to choose from. Best part of the stay was the girl who worked the front desk, great to chat with!

Reviews.Title: “noisiest hotel I ever had in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jhc019
Reviews.Content: If I was asked to say one word about hotel Margaret it would be: NOISE. Since ten years and multiple trips I stayed in many Rome hotels within the same price range and Margaret was the noisiest I ever had. It is situated on the cross-road of two very busy streets, and there is a traffic starting at 5.30 which is simply unbearable. If you want to know how does it feel to sleep under the bridge of a very busy highway, try Margaret. Moreover the heating is largely unsufficient: it works - sometimes - from 19 up to 22.00 and not in the morning, so you take shower and go out in a chilly room, very comfortable... there are however some bright spots: the hotel is very clean if not spotless, the towels are changed daily, the beds are firm enough, there is a good wi-fi connection. The breakfast is ineventful: you get two types of most basic cereals (but eat as much as you like - I didn't), milk, two very water-diluted juices, one small white bread and one croissant, biscuits, butter and jam. Coffee out of the machine is horrible - shame for Italy - but good Twinnings tea along with awful Lipton Yellow was a nice surprise. One should remember that even if the breakfast is rather untasteful, the most hotels of such a category will provide you with a ticket for a coffee and pastry in nearby bar, and that is, so to have a breakfast in the hotel is a welcome feature. AThe personal is very nice and friendly and you really feel they are genuinly try to do their best to help you but they can't help for the main drawback - noise, noise, noise. So I wouldn't recommend it unless you are a very heavy sleeper with a soudproof mentality.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 2 star hotel, location is not so good”
Reviews.Author: Alexsandro1
Reviews.Content: This is not a 2 star hotel. It is at most a hostel. It is located at the 4th floor of a commercial building, I have never seen such thing. You have to intercom them so they unlock the heavy door downstairs. Then you have to climb a dozen steps to be able to use a very, very old elevator/lift (very scary and small). The apartment was OK for a hostel, but not for a 2 star hotel, and it was very noisy, we woke up every morning with horns and syrens from cars on the street 4 floors below, we couldn't stand it anymore. The bathroom was small, hair dryer would heat, shower box door was broken. Our service included "continental breakfast", which was basically bread, butter/jelly and coffee from an automatic machine! Worst breakfast in Europe. We considered it too expensive for what it had to offer, it should charge as a hostel, not a 2 star hotel. And LOCATION? It was 10 minutes from the Termini Station, which is a train station where you arrive from the airport, it is not a landmark. You have to walk a lot if you want to see things without taking buses or the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price for Rome but disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: freystyle
Reviews.Content: Location near a subway and the main train/bus/subway terminal (Termini). Easy walk to where the FREE Rome tours start. We have 3 people in one room with 4 beds and a bathroom for 90 Euros a night. Wifi only works in the hallway and the bathroom doors and shower head are on their last legs. AC is so-so. We have it set at 16C but it's still slightly warm right now an it's 6:44 pm. We won't leave our keys at the front desk because we found it unattended this morning and could have easily taken a key from the box and opened another room... Scary! Otherwise, OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Monica provided great service - above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Mavzee
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive place to stay convenient to the train station for a day and a half layover. The hotel provided what we needed PLUS Monica gave us great suggestions on where we might eat with our young kids and what to try to see in Rome in one day. She showed us the bus lines convenient to the hotel. She also got us a good deal on a taxi to the airport AND she had coffee ready at 6:30 in the morning on the day of our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Margaret: A great sanctuary at a great value”
Reviews.Author: tsek11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Margaret worked wonderfully for us. The room was small but clean, nicely decorated, overlooking the street and not at all noise-some. (we slept with the windows open and were greeted by birdsong in the morning) The staff was friendly and helpful. It was in walking distance to the terminal and major sights and was very pleasant and, peaceful, and a great value as well. Thank you, Hotel Margaret.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Margaret was such a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jbandjb99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Italy in May and after visiting Venice and Florence, we ended our trip in Rome. I booked our room at Hotel Margaret based on previous reviews and a recommendation in the Rick Steves guide. The hotel is close to the train station, only about a 10 minute walk. We've heard the area around the train station wasn't safe, but we never got a sense of that at all. The hotel is small, but was very clean and comfortable. Ask for a room with a private bath, but expect small like most European hotels. The room had air conditioning and access to WiFi. Breakfast every morning was very good croissants, bread, juice and coffee and made for a good start to the day. The staff, particularly Monica, were all SO friendly and helpful. We got great advice on restaurants in the neighborhood and about sightseeing in Rome. The restaurant across the street, Da Giovanni, is excellent as well. I would absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great value, great staff, excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Minn17
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at Hotel Margaret and truly had an excellent stay. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Termini Station, close to useful bus routes and not too far from the Repubblica metro stop. Our room had two comfortable twin beds and a private bathroom, perfect for my father and I. We never heard a peep from other guests nor street noise. The greatest strength of the hotel for was the helpful and personable staff/owners. We ended up having some unexpected needs and the staff went out of their way to help us in every way. They were also helpful with recomendations. We had a nice meal at Ristorante da Giovanni across the street, but the location is 5-10 minutes walk from greater dining options. We would make a point to stay here again. Thank you for the great stay!

Reviews.Title: “good and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: bond30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near from Roma termini and well located. Moreover, if someone on a budget, I highly recommend the Margaret. It is a family run hotel. The room was bit small but clean including toilet. This is about the hotel, in general about Rome one has be very careful about their belongings. Petty thiefs are more probable.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hotel Margaret”
Reviews.Author: emmam72
Reviews.Content: Great little place - authentic with a nice touch of homliness. Very clean and comfortable, safe and close to the train. Easy walk doen to the spanish steps and near where all the tours leave. Recommended. Great little find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KrissyH
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two friends stayed at the Hotel Margaret for a week in October. It is a great hotel, very clean and well within walking distance of all Rome sights. It is close to the termini station (a five minute walk) which saves on taxi costs. The area was quiet and we had no problems walking in the area after dark. We felt very safe. The restaurant across the street is very good "Restorante De Giovanni". Monica was fabulous. She made us feel like long lost family. We have a double room and our friends had a triple room. We had more than enough room in our double w/toilet. I recommend this place and will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It wasn´t a good experience”
Reviews.Author: luna_desertica
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the lady who is the owner is very kind, the rooms are very little and really dark. They said the breakfast was included, but they never serve us one because the "kitchen" was closed for a reason. The matresses we got were quite old. The "hotel" is expensive for the service and the rooms they offer. Even if it´s "near" the station Termini, you have to walk around 20 minutes to arrive to the hotel. If you can get something else, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: swissworld
Reviews.Content: Rooms have AC and that is a big plus, the double bed was super small and so was the room, my mistake for not ordering 2 beds instead of one. Some other rooms with 2 separate beds looked way bigger.Free Wifi, small uneventful breakfast with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: brett13sky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on a budget, but did not want to stay near the train station area. We walked about 5-10 minutes from the train station to an area that was mostly businesses and government buildings, but very quiet. The hotel is run by an older Italian couple and younger daughter. Although the rooms were tiny (this is Rome though), the kept the area spotless. We received answers to all our questions and everyone spoke good English. The breakfest was included for 80 Euros a night for a double room with bath, but nothing special. The area was a slight walk from the monuments, but this is Rome and you are going to walk a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, but be careful”
Reviews.Author: andrewandtanya
Reviews.Content: After an unfortunate beginning in Rome the experience was basic and serviceable experience. Like many hotels in Rome it is a couple of floors in a large old office tower. It is in the seedy end of Rome near the train station. Make sure you have a fair idea where it is before you arrive because it is a little challenging to find a map that has the street marked. The older couple who run the place are very enthusiastic if pre-occupied with scaring young tourists about pick-pockets. We had a clean room with air-conditioning and a shared bathroom. Apart from the tendency of other people to spend hours in the shower it was quite good, very clean and nice. Do not bother about the "included breakfast". The pre-packaged bread products and almost undrinkable coffee explained why we were the only guests eating breakfast. We had a small incident when we came to pay about whether the credit card machine was working. After explaining we had no cash left and there were several signs indicating they took credit card we finally convinced the owner to try the machine which "remarkably" worked. As always, make sure you know exactly how you are going to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Margaret Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Paleo1
Reviews.Content: For someone on a budget, I highly recommend the Margaret. It is a family run hotel. The management is very helpful, the location is excellent, being very near a train station that serves all of Italy. The room was spacious and clean, as was the bathroom, which was newly renovated in the new wing. The continental breakfast was more than adequate. JAS from New York City

Reviews.Title: “Really Recommend Hotel Margaret”
Reviews.Author: andyAustralia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Margaret is real value for money. If you are looking to wake up and leave the hotel to see Rome all day, and to basically only sleep at the hotel it is fantastic. It was very well priced, great/safe location (only 5 min walk to Roma Termini main station. You can easily walk to every sight from here, and even walking aroung late at night near the hotel you feel safe. The room and bathroom were small, but very very clean. If you want to stay in the hotel and relax, then its prob not for you... but if you arelooking for a cheap/well located/clean place to sleep, then book here. It is a family run business so they really take good care of you, super firendly staff. Also, if you stay here, go directly across the road from the hotel and eat at Giovanni's, Cheap fantastic local food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: ReaG
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at Hotel Margaret, it was so close to Termini station and accessible to all the attractions by foot. The room was clean and the bed so so comfy! The air conditioning was brand new and the room was very quiet at night. Breakfast was simple, croissant and coffee - but the coffee was amazing and the service good. The couple that run the hotel were so lovely and talked us through the attractions and circled them on the map for us, they also made us aware of the areas that are not so safe at night, and of the pickpockets and the way they operate. I would not hesitate to return to Hotel Margaret and recommend it to all who are planning a cheap break to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Chaep and Central”
Reviews.Author: Dee76
Reviews.Content: First lets get one thing straight - Hotel Margaret is not a Hotel in the strict sense of the word. It is a number of apartments in a building in Rome that has been changed into a 'Hotel'. Secondly, the walls are just a partition so you can hear the other people chat in their respective rooms. Now in terms of advantages it is cheap, the owners are friendly and helpful, the room and bed linen is clean, and it is 5 minutes from Statione Termini. We stayed in it for 2 nights, we were out early and back late and it was perfect. But I would only recommend it for back packing students who are sick of hostels but want to pay a hostel price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler777t
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel. It is convenient to the main train station and subway. The owners are very nice and fun to talk with. The rooms are small, but we just wanted a place to sleep at night and shower, so this was just what we needed. Very safe. It is on a busy corner that gets noisy in the morning. Highly recommend and would stay here again if we go back to Rome. Good value compared to other hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katlehn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was huge (we got a 4 people room for 2 of us - it was their last room) clean but definately not fancy. the bathroom however, was new but there was no Bar fridge :( Breakfast wasn't great but at the price we paid it wasn't a big deal. The couple who ran the place were very helpful and friendly. their english was not 100% but they tried very hard (with success!) to explain things to do, see and be wary of in Rome. The room was noisy but as others have said, this comes with being so central. Rome is in itself a very noisy, busy and exciting place! The hotel is around 10 minutes walk from the train station. We arrived by train at night - didn't feel too safe until well past the train station surrounds but then it was fine. All in all this hotel was friendly, clean, comfortable enough , very well located and a great price for Rome. It's not the Hilton but neither is it's price and one doesn't spend a great deal of time in their room when in Rome anyway. Perth, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “friendly budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lozmum
Reviews.Content: we loved our stay - a novelty & memorable..very helpful friendly family owners. great central location. luckily we stayed on the renovated side - room was clean & adequate, & secure. the reception side smelled a bit musty & stale. breakfast was very ordinary-crumpled tablecloths, but may suit some people - packet bread/biscuits, instant coffee in a pot. the tiny ancient elevator was a novelty..especially fitting in 3 people & bags- good budget hotel -unable to comment on the original (reception) side though.

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made a very last minute booking at the Hotel Margaret after being let down elsewhere. the airport bus left us near the station and it was only a short walk to the hotel through streets in the commercial district which always felt very safe. We had a very wet stay and used the bus on several occasions to shelter from the rain but the hotel is very well situated for walking to the major sites. Our room was rather basic and a little cramped for three but we managed well. Everything was very clean, we had fresh towels every day and the beds, inclding the additional third bed, were extremely comfortable. Our arrangements did not include breakfast so we cannot comment on the food but a local cafe had good coffee, cakes and marvellous hot chocolate at a very low price. We have two quibbles. One concerned the shower which only provided hot water spasmodically. The other was traffic noise but we did feel that this was probably something which has to be traded in for a central location. The hotel is family run and although the owner speaks only a little English he went to enormous lengths to explain how to get to the places we wanted to see, how to use local transport, where to get coffee and snacks for a good price and, most helpfully, how to avoid pick pockets. He was particularly helpful when one of us tried to change a flight and insisted on telephoning the airport for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: minnesotagirl0213
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Margaret. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. We got good coffee and an okay croissant for breakfast each morning. It is located on the 4th floor, but no worries, there is a lift! The hotel is in a good location and within walking distance of almost anything you might want to see during your stay in Rome. We didn't take any busses or taxies except from the airport, walking is the best way to discover the city! If you would rather take the bus though, there is a stop right by the hotel. The train station is very close too. There is a small restaurant across the street called Giovanni's which had excellent food and low prices. We will stay at Hotel Margaret again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Run by a wonderful couple, our room was small but very clean and with a new bathroom. Great location, especially for the price! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Margaret Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Antonio Salandra 6, 00187 Rome, Italy
